It's delicious anyway! !
On weekdays, there was no seating time, so I was able to stay until I felt like it! There were many types of drinks.

Came here for an end of year party for my office. It's a bit tucked away down a small side street.
The entryway is VERY SMALL and low, everyone had to hunch over to get it. Other than that the establishment is really clean and nice.

The staff were very attentive even though we were a large group (about 20 persons). We had the downstairs dining area reserved. The cooking area was off to the side but you could see the staff at work behind the short curtains. Someone was always present to take orders and other requests

It seems like it would be Japanese style seating but there is a well of sorts beneath the tables so that person's can sit regularly.

We had a 7 course meal. This party cost 7,000 yen each, it included nabe,fois gras, sashimi, a seafood mix, steamed codfish with its testicles, noodles that accompanied the nabe soup stock, rare steak slices with veggies and dessert of ice cream and fruit. Everything was great other than the codfish thing. That looked very unappealing and oily.

Overall it was a lovely experience.
They have unlimited drink deals for 90, 120 & 180 minutes. Good quality food, prompt service and well priced.

It is said to be a warehouse in Hakodate, but the name of the store is something like ``Goryokaku,'' and you have to walk up and down the stairs twice.
When I asked the store clerk, she said, ``This is it,'' and I went inside the store, unconvinced.
I feel a bit uneasy...
Each meal is small.
I guess I won't go anymore
Loved the staff, they are so friendly. And they gave me a gift when I ordered several dished.

We found this restaurant via Google map. All the foods we ordered are delicious. The skin for the xiao long bao is a bit too thick but still tastes good. Dark sauce fried rice, onden and gyoza are the best.

It is really refreshing after eating so much seafood from Otaru to Hakodate.

One of the waiter is very friendly and speaks good English. We appreciate his effort to recommend their popular dishses and strike up a conversation with us. ğŸ˜

The basic drink menu for the "all you can drink" course doesn't include beer! If you want beer, you have to upgrade to the next course.
Also, the all-you-can-eat menu is basically various snacks with a few salads. I guess it's a fine course if you just wanna have some snacks with friends while drinking, but not great if you want to feel like you're eating "a real meal".
You order off the tablet. It says there's an English option, but there's not, really. The tabs are in English, but all the food and drink items are in Japanese, still. If you can't read kanji, you have to go by the pictures.
The food itself was really good, and cooked well. The service was also really fast. The drinks arrived almost right after we ordered, and the food was also very quick.
Have a lot small partions private areas.  Chicken is delicious, not matter BBQ or on pan. Not lift.
Good quality sea food (and others) for an affordable price! The staffs were friendly and chatted a little with us. Would definitely recommend and come back again!

Used for drinking parties on weekdays.

The food is generally delicious and cheap. The cost performance is good.
As other people have commented, when I visited, there was only one person assigned to the kitchen and one person in the hall, but the wait from ordering to serving the food was not that long...

As I was drinking, I thought, ``As expected,'' but at the same time I felt sympathy for him, thinking, ``It must be difficult.''

It is difficult to secure human resources, but if we had 1 more person + 1 person, it would have been a 4 star.

However, the food was delicious and the alcohol was average...

Thank you for the meal.

Since it was a private room, I thought it would be safe even during the coronavirus pandemic, but even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room, the smell of cigarettes in the private room was unbearable. However, they brought an air purifier right away, which was helpful. Nice response!
I was very disappointed that the food I wanted to eat was always sold out, but the food I was able to eat was very deliciousğŸ˜ŠğŸ‘
The food was tasty enough, but the staff got confused with the orders. For me, the worst thing was that the restaurant smelled of tobacco and all my clothes stank of it.

Our Japanese friend helped us booked it! It was amazing! We had 5500 yen set, which freed us from struggling what to order. All meat was amazing that melting in your mouth! Donâ€™t forget to book it is busy time! Highly recommend! Except the set, we finalized the dinner with a bowl of cold noodle. The noodles texture tasted really like hard ramen, the soup was super clean and fresh!

Nothing went wrong, just amazing.

4.6 - I had their signature offal hot pot with soy sauce, grilled Hokke (Okhotsk Atka Mackerel) and some shellfish sashimi. They all tasted very delectable and prices were decent. Besides, owner is super polite and friendly. This izakaya reminded me of Showa era.

This place has large portions! And also caters to groups.
The food is delicious but you may need to wait a few minutes for your order to arrive. I ordered the chicken and spinach omrice (ãƒã‚­ãƒ³ã¨ã»ã‚Œã‚“ãã®ãƒŸãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ ã‚ªãƒ ãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚¹.) The self size, this was the smallest size available and rather filling.
The fried basket a la carte is also very delicious and big enough to share. I certainly recommend coming to this restaurant.

The food itself was really good. The only downside was that it took a really long time for things to come out. We were hoping to try things and then order more, but it took too long. If you're going during a busy time, I'd suggest ordering everything you want all at once.

The seafood chirashi was great (and looked super impressive) and I really enjoyed my crab and tuna mayo rice bowl. Yakitori was good too but we thought the Yakiniku was a bit overcooked. They have a large variety of dishes and we would have gone back if we hadn't run out of time.

It didn't seem that crowded, but I had a hard time getting someone to take my order. I felt that the procedure was worse than the one-off surgery.

There are many skewers on the menu, but what about the names of the skewers? You can't tell from scratch, and there are no written instructions, so you have to ask the staff each time you order.

The price of the skewers is reasonable, but the other snacks seem to be priced relatively high. Is it a large amount?

I was imagining crispy grilled cheese wrapped in a so-called spring roll wrapper, but it was something I didn't expect at all.
The cheese itself is crunchy, like a snack, and is eaten with pizza sauce. It was new to me as a snack.

There is a wide variety of skewers on the menu, so I think you can enjoy a variety of things.
Overpriced and not very good. Bland sausages and cheese. Wouldn't recommend :(.

A great place to come for a quick bite alongside some drinks with your friends. Service can be slightly slow but the taste of food pairs well with the drinks.

Would highly recommend the yakitori as it has a good char and was seasoned well. Karaage was juicy and flavourful whilst not being too oily.

Kushiyaki tasted average but the potato and ham&cheese is a must try. Like the thoughtfulness they had when they gave us free quail eggs for every drink we ordered

Great, laid back but fancy atmosphere. The lunch sets offer high class food at a reasonable price. Side dishes mean you can stay a while and eat your fill. I ordered the venison, a rarity, and it was worth it. The thin sliced meat maximized the surface area, the ponzu sauce complimented the meat and oolong tea washed it all down. A better combo doesn't exist. Any venison lovers or meat fans in general should check it out (it costs about Â¥1400 for the venison dish and drink).

Sorry no pictures. I just ate here (July 2023) and this izakaya was great. Everything was just a little better than it should have been for the price.

Ordering system is via QR codeâ€”which I normally don't care forâ€”but once I got my head around the system, it was super easy to use, and also lets you keep an eye on your running tab, so there are no surprises at the end. Lack of a detailed check can sometimes be vexing at izakayas, especially if you are a foreign tourist and worried about being taken advantage of. The website shows a detailed total of everything you've ordered.

I'm able to use Japanese, but one advantage of this store's QR code system is that if you open the ordering site on a browser with built-in translation (google chrome, etc.), you can see all the items on the menu translated into whatever language you choose. So even though I could have æˆ‘æ…¢'d in Japanese, I just let Chrome translate everything. This became more useful after a few drinks :-/

High points: Japanese-style tuna and avocado salad (amazing), shiso and chicken gyoza (also amazing); grilled shishito peppers, tsukne (chicken meatball) and fried potatoes all above average.

BGM is American hip-hop with super-obscene English lyrics, so if that could be a problem for you, please take note. (It's not for me.)

Staff was super pleasant, and an all-around great experience. Recommended, if I'm back in Hakodate I shall return.

(Also note that my total may be higher than average because I drank a lot. You could easily get out of here for Â¥2,000â€“Â¥3,500 if you are not drinking much.)

I like this Izakaya. Service was good, food was fresh and reasonable price. They have so many option to chose on the menu. This restaurant is located few min walking distance from Hakodate station. We enjoyed very much. Luckily it wasnâ€™t busy at the time (5pm) so we were able to walk in. If you are traveling busy season, would recommend to make a reservation.

I happened to go to an izakaya in Hakodate.
The menu has a wide range of options, and I was very impressed with how delicious it was!
The sashimi is beautiful and delicious, so this is the restaurant I would recommend if I was asked to introduce an izakaya in Hakodate!

My favorite is the red of skirt steak.
It's a busy restaurant, so I think it's best to make a reservation by phone.
The cost performance isn't great, but it's delicious so it's acceptable.

Excellent service and have English speaking staff which super friendly and informative!! (I believe one of two speak) Accept credit card and plenty of parking and very reasonable price! Massive of selection of raw meat for Yakiniku, veggies, cooked food, noddles, curry and ice cream and deserts. I would recommend to everyone who is coming to Hakodate!! See the pictures I took for reference.

Codfish set meal Â¥750 It's fun with a variety of small dishes.
The fried codfish had no unpleasant smell, was fluffy, voluminous, and delicious. The price was cheap and I was very satisfied.
We also recommend the fried mackerel set meal with black vinegar sauce and the tempura set meal.

I often use it at girls' night out.
The shrimp in the shrimp mayo is very big, filling, and filling, so I order it every time. It's so delicious that you'll want to eat it all by yourselfâ˜†
The dashimaki egg is also fluffy and delicious â˜†

The BEST service we got while in Japan! We reserved omakase dinner the day of and got a private room seating. We had a party of 4 (2 adults, 1 child under 3 and a baby under 1 year). The restaurant was very clean and inviting. The two service providers were so sweet and accommodating. They set up a little mattress for our 3 month old to sleep on while we ate. Had a wonderful 8 course degustation menu on 30.10.2019 at Wanofu.
Ms Yoko Yonemoto explained to us that every one of them was prepared by chef Takuya ( in the photo with a sumo customer)
I think he is her husband . She says he is a crazy about Formula 1 and was just in Singapore in Sept.

I wonder if the only employees at the store are women. Although they don't qualify as gals, they are all young, energetic, and beautiful.
To be honest, I thought the taste might not be what I expected, but it was surprisingly delicious. The sashimi is also fresher than at a crappy izakaya. Ajillo was delicious. It would be even more delicious if it had mushrooms in it.
It's a shame that the price compared to the quantity is the same as or lower than the price at the izakaya in the Goryokaku area.
In the Daimon area, the price and taste balance is getting better.
The menu isn't bad, but I'd like some nikujagaya or izakaya-style skewers. (I think it would be better if there were more menu items)

The way the rice balls were held was good, and the Saikyoyaki was delicious.
This is a healing shop for men who have worked hard at work.

I visited because it was featured on local cable TV and was within walking distance from my house. It's a small and relaxing space. The counter is comfortable for a single person. It's nice to have a wide variety of drinks. The reasonably priced wine by the glass selection includes two types of white and red, as well as rosÃ© and orange wine. The basic ham and cheese is delicious, and you can tell they use good quality ingredients. The other Spanish dishes were also made with carefully selected ingredients and well-seasoned, and I was very satisfied. The unpretentious personality of the store staff is also wonderful. Next time I visit, I would like to enjoy the Western food menu and whiskey too ğŸ˜„

Visited on a Monday afternoon at 4pm. Nice and cozy. Wooden fence at the main entrance gives privacy, and keeps out the heat and glare from the setting sun. Service crew were extremely friendly and attentive.

Very nice staff, awesome shishas. I'm from Germany and neither there nor in the Netherlands do they refresh your shisha coals. They do it here as long as the shisha is still going strong and it's just such a nice smoke that way.
The staff also spoke good English so even with minor Japanese language communication was very easy!

Must visit bar in Hakodate. Guinness draught beer on tap, it pairs really well with the soba. The owner was really friendly and I accidentally paid additional 10,000 Yen to our bill but he gave it back. Japanese honesty and hospitality at itâ€™s finest.

Diner-style vibe with tasty food and quick service. English on menus!

The staff was really nice and our food came out pretty quick. The food itself was also really tasty. The dessert was especially cute and tasted good.
My only qualm was that I wished the main dish was hotter. The deep-fried appetizers were hot and fresh, but the meat was just warm, and the rice was barely warm. Other than that, everything was really good.

I went there for a year-end party.
No matter what I ate, it was so delicious that I forgot to take a photo and forgot the name.
This is called careful work, but is this what you call preparatory work? It's a Japanese restaurant for adults, with really careful and delicate dishes!
Although it's for adults, it's not too expensive and has private Japanese-style rooms, making it the perfect hideaway!
You can enjoy a drink while enjoying a pleasant conversation with the owner at the counter, or you can enjoy a drink in a private room.
No matter what you eat, the food is really delicious and I highly recommend this restaurant!

Dinner at Hakodate Hondori ``Teppan''.
The happiness of drinking a cold draft beer while feeling the heat of the griddle on your face. It is good manners for a drinker to finish one drink after another before the heat reaches the mug.
I often make ``Monjayaki'' at home, but in this damn heat, going to the store is the right thing to do. On this day, we had tomato monja and Matsumae-zuke monja, both of which were perfect accompaniments to beer. The spicy yakisoba I ordered to finish the meal was really spicy, so I decided to add another beer.
Reservation required. Okonomiyaki and yakisoba are grilled at the restaurant. There are also plenty of snacks other than Teppanyaki.

[The Kosan area of â€‹â€‹Hakodate City has little snowfall, is affected by active volcanoes, and has high geothermal heat even in winter. It is the main breeding ground for sika deer.

Sika deer near Hakodate live along the Tsugaru Strait. In addition to weeds rich in salt and minerals, they also eat field crops such as carrots, potatoes, pumpkins, and edamame.

Due to the aging of the population, there are fewer farmers and hunters. Wild deer are no longer a threat, and there are more abandoned farmlands to feast on. The reproduction rate is astonishing, forcing the Japanese government to encourage people to hunt and eat game, and even restaurants are offering venison meals. According to statistics, agricultural losses caused by wild animals in Japan exceed 20 billion yen every year, and wild deer and wild boars are both known as the two major pests. ã€•

It's a hidden gem located in a narrow alley on the road.It's part of an old house that has been renovated.For some reason, the female clerk didn't serve tea to all the other customers without saying anything, but she didn't serve it to me, which caused discrimination. Is that so! ? I felt sick. I had a lunch of about 1 mini soba bowl, about 3 small bites of small rice, about 3 small bites of vegetable tempura, salad, and shinko, but there wasn't a lot of soba either, and overall I wasn't satisfied with the soba flour. I think they use good ones. I think it's good for girls who eat very little, but it's not enough for guys.
It is located on a narrow, one-way street with only three parking spaces, and is difficult to find and reach.
I don't think I'll go again.

I had a chance to talk about various things with the friendly and interesting master.
After visiting two restaurants in Hakodate, I wanted to go to a third bar, so I wandered around the city for about 30 minutes in the cold, looking for a bar that suited me, but most of the bars were filled with young people. There were a lot of shops that felt cluttered and noisy, so I didn't feel comfortable. This store is on the second floor, and I didn't know what it was like inside, so it took a lot of courage to enter, but I really wanted to go in, so my companion and I decided to go inside and decided to try it out. I did. It was correct. The time passed quickly as I drank slowly and quietly, and talked happily with my master about various things.
I don't have many opportunities to go to Hakodate, but I often think about this shop and the master, and wonder if he's doing well. That's what I'm thinking. I will definitely go again if I go to Hakodate. Until then, I definitely want the store to continue operating.

To the shop staff,

I visited with a dinner reservation. A stylish, calm and bright interior. There is a wonderful chef and courteous staff in the open kitchen. From the appetizers to the desserts, every dish was carefully prepared and had a pop of pop, and when it arrived at the table, it made me feel warm. It is a restaurant where you can enjoy the pleasure of enjoying excellent French cuisine at reasonable prices.

We really loved our lunch here! Everything was delicious and they are so friendly and welcoming. The restaurant is very cozy and comfortable. My pesto spaghetti was perfect and the dessert was delicious! Great value for the money. Thank you for a wonderful meal!

I recently learned that they were open for lunch, so I went to visit them right away.
When I entered the restaurant and told them I was alone, I was shown to a seat.
I was curious about the hamburger steak, which is limited to 10 servings, so I ordered it.
The food was served in about 10 minutes.
I was impressed by the gorgeous arrangement, which was more than I expected.
Demi said it was homemade.
It was a slightly bitter demi type.
I was told that the sheet that is topped on top of the cold chawanmushi can be eaten as is or broken into pieces and eaten with the chawanmushi, so I took it as is and then broke the rest up and had it with the chawanmushi.
The sheets were peppery and spicy, and the chawanmushi had a creamy and gentle taste.
The seat I was shown to was separated by a roll curtain, so you couldn't see the person next to you, but the roll curtain was slightly transparent, so you could see the silhouette and movements, and it felt a little small. It was the seat of
I thought it couldn't be helped since I was alone, but the person who came later was also probably alone, but I was directed to a comfortable seat a little further away across the street.
The person next to me was a smoker, so I thought it would have been better if the person who came later was shown to the seat.
Can I choose my seat when it's busy? Or, I thought it would be nice to be able to sit a little further away from the customers in front of me.
Other than that, the food was delicious and the customer service was very polite and pleasant, so I would like to visit again.
Pay your bill at your seat after your meal.
I was able to use smartphone payment.

I can only say that I am very satisfied with this.
When the plate of appetizers appeared, everyone around the table let out a voice of admiration. A beauty that you hesitate to touch. And any antipasto goes perfectly with wine. If you have a normal stomach, Primo's pasta will be enough to fill you up after this. If you can make it to the second restaurant, you'll be able to enjoy simple Italian meat dishes that allow you to appreciate the flavor of the ingredients. Dolce is completely different.
Reservation required. Reservations for the appetizer platter must be made at least one day in advance. Cash only. There is a parking space near the store. The location is complicated and difficult to understand, but it's also fun.

It was an izakaya located on the outskirts of Hakodate City, near Hokkaido University's Faculty of Fisheries. It was in a residential area and there were no tourists in sight. Although the main dish is seafood, the gyoza is delicious and loved by the locals. It cost around 10,000 yen for the two of us to drink, so it might be a little expensive for students, but I think it's okay for an older man (lol).

The food was delicious, but the management's attitude was poor. I'm not going out to eat to hear people being yelled at, so I'll think about it the next time I go.
a modern looking soba restaurant and cafe bar, though having a traditonal history more than 70 years. you can have a good time and good foods here.

Every meal was delicious.
The appetizers, salmon and wasabi-marinated tobikko, sashimi, and yakitori are delicious, and are perfect to accompany alcohol.
The fried tofu is the best I have ever eaten.
They also served sake according to my taste.
The owner and the landlady were both friendly and I had a lot of fun even though I was drinking alone.

Iâ€™m at a small (actually one of the larger cafes in this city)! The curry rice was scrumptious! Full of flavor and just heat to keep you interested! Service was very good with a friendly smile by the owner!
The sponge cake was very lost and delicious! Unfortunately the latte was lacking! But Iâ€™ll be back for the food again!

Lamb Mongolian BBQ Restaurant. It is cooked in the hot grill in front of the customers.
Lamb is tasty.
Warning. Since the restaurant is very small closed room. After eating, the BBQ, the barbecue smell will stick to the hair.

The owner is a former fisherman and we were able to enjoy fresh sashimi!
He looks a little unfriendly, but when you talk to him, he's friendly and I'll definitely come back again ğŸº

Guys and girls, this is were the locals in Hakodate eat, and for good reason. It is a mom and pop type of restaurant and I promise you, after you taste their sushis, you will never want to eat at sushi place in the US or Canada again. Food is an art. When you eat a real Unagi (eel) roll at this place, you feel as if a concert of flavor is playing in your mouth. It is an incredible food experience that I would recommend to anyone who wants to discover what a real sushi place is.
Lively vibe, friendly staff, awesome living space and amenities. Hands down, the best hostel that Iâ€™ve ever stayed, highly recommend!
The drink was delicious
Recommend cafe in Hakodate with great tea and a fantastic atmosphere!

Anyway, all the dishes are very carefully prepared. The mackerel stewed in miso is full of volume and the preparation is perfect, so you can eat the bones without any unpleasant taste. The natto omelet was also excellent. The customer service is polite in the private room, and there are 3 bottles of beer. I drank, and the bill was cheaper than I expected, so I was satisfied with the amount.
Very friendly owner, even to non-Japanese speakers. Food is fresh and delicious, especially the sashimi.

We chose from 3 regular types of waffles and seasonal specials, and had cinnamon waffles and English milk tea. We also have a sandwich and drink set for lunch, so you can come to the store for a meal as well. The tea was served in a pot, so I was able to spend a relaxing time in the store with piano music playing.

Walked to this Ramen shop as itâ€™s near my hotel. Had the salted shio ramen and spicy miso ramen. Both are very good. Soup is tasty and noodle is cooked al dente. Cha Shu is melt in your mouth and bamboo shoots are nicely done. The fried rice is average . Try their gyoza too.

Great place for our dinner with or without kids! Why? The food is just great and prices are very reasonable! Service is great by the couple owners! Although we canâ€™t converse in Japanese language, they are very polite to try to explain the food to us. We didnâ€™t really understand everything but the food still turned out fabulous!!! Thank you for the great dinner!

This is a shop run by a mom alone.
I heard them talking with the regulars and they seemed friendly ğŸ˜Š I'm thinking of going again.

A typical "mom 'n pop" shop along the Hakodate mornjng market. This restaurant is a great find, as the price of their food is reasonable!

I ordered the butter Ramen with crab and ikura don set. Butter salt ramen is famous in Hakodate, so this is a must have. The crab and ikura don was also delicious! A small, yet elegant bowl!

Nice little Italian place that have better pasta and risotto then Milan, Venice & Florence! I definitely will be when I want some Italian!
Owner chef is also very friendly without speaking much English!

We were looking for a casual place for lunch on a grey, rainy and cold day and found this place. The sausages were great, we had extras, and it also sold locally brewed beer in the form of KÃ¶lsch and Alt. Well worth the stop. Also, great to know that it isn't just some imitation Western Fast food place but, instead, has almost 100 years of history in town!

Very good place and nice hostess ğŸ˜ŒğŸ˜Œ

The beef and other meat were so delicious with good quality, and the price was reasonable.

Advance booking was made about a month ago and we chose 4 sets of e-san dinners that came with choice of wagyu sirloin or tenderloin.  Seafood such as prawns, scallops and others were served in broth to perfection. In-between, other foods were served too.

The manager on duty was accommodative to us and changed the raw carpaccio to other cooked seafood.

A tuna specialty store where you can enjoy tuna caught in Toi, Hakodate.
The menu consists of simple tuna bowls, sushi, and sashimi, and is all red.
This time, in order to fully enjoy the tuna from Toi, I ordered the 5 kinds of tuna bowl (Toi tuna option + large serving of rice, 4,400 yen including tax).
The 5 types include 2 slices each of Negitoro, red meat, medium fatty tuna, large fatty tuna, and two pieces of grilled kamatoro, making it a masterpiece. First, we tasted the lean meat without adding anything, then we poured soy sauce around the bowl and added one slice of each slice, and added wasabi to the rest.
The taste is truly exquisite. I have tasted domestic tuna from Shiogama and Katsuura, but the Tsugaru Strait has a rich flavor that is completely different. Oma is famous for the tuna in the Tsugaru Strait, but this is recommended as it is a short walk from Goryokaku Station, making it easier to visit both within and outside of Hokkaido.
It's a bit pricey, but the tuna was worth it.

Open until late and reasonably priced. There's food and it's easy to get to â— If you're having trouble finding a place to go, come here. The people at the store are friendly and the customers range from young people to the elderly. There is also karaoke.

Owner is really nice!

The rapper Post Malone also came in here and the owner said they didnâ€™t know who he was but took a picture with him (see below)

Thereâ€™s fresh Guiness and a local specialty Sapporo beer Edelpils on draft.

The owner also makes his own beer which is super tasty! Love the cozy feeling they provide here!

Highly recommend!

PS:

His daughter also runs Eillys a bit further in town!

Recommended! Shio ramen is testy but refreshing. Spicy one is also good, not spicy that much, you can enjoy the teste in every bite. Gyoza is really really good, juicy, coporated very well with beer. Beware, everything here are HOT.
very friendly staff. food is good and huge portion. nice ambiance. can handle large group. highly recommended.

I was very interested in the restaurant after reading about it on a blog written by someone who lives in the city, so I visited without making a reservation, but unfortunately I was unable to enter as it was fully booked that day.
I made a reservation for another day and visited.
I had kind of decided what to eat based on reviews, but the quiche lunch was closed that day, so I decided to order quiche. I thought it would be stewed, so I chose stewed.
I thought it would be cream-stewed young chicken and mountain burdock, but when I actually looked at the menu, I thought it was stewed beef.
At a loss, I decided to order the young chicken, which I had decided on before coming to the store.
The meal begins with the appetizer and is served one plate at a time when the meal is finished.
I'm embarrassed to say that I don't know much about etiquette, so I ended up doing it my own way.
The first appetizer that was served was a potage of Tokachi mushroom terrine and butterbur sprouts.
For potage, please hold the bowl in your hands and enjoy the aroma.
I don't like the bitterness that follows the taste of butterbur, but although there was a slight bitterness, it didn't feel like it followed me, so it was easy to drink and delicious.
I'm a big eater, so if I wanted to be a little more filling, I thought a pasta lunch would be better.
I'm also interested in the quiche, they have a wide variety of pasta menus, and the cakes all looked so delicious that I couldn't decide, so I'd like to visit again.
Rather authentic Indian Curry Restaurant with such fabulous customer service. The food is AMAZING!!! I'll definitely be going back.

Walked in on a random night after walking around the bay area- they welcomed us even though it was 45 minutes to closing time. Unlike a commercialised sushi conveyor belt restaurant, this place makes the sushi to order- hence, maintaining the freshness.

All the sushi we ordered here was fresh and taste good. I like that they allow us to opt for half rice for their sushi to allow us to try more. We also tried the deep fried hokkaido potatoes which were fluffy and sweet.

Must try of the sushi would be the fatty tuna, selection of the day, salmon and ikura.

If you like sound, you'll find it irresistibly calming. The amp, speakers, and high ceiling space are great.
A restaurant where you will be warmly welcomed by the owner, who has been a bar fan for 32 years. It's an adult bar, but it's not pretentious.
A place where you can enjoy music in a quiet atmosphere - alcohol is reasonably priced...there's a wide variety of records.
I'm glad that you can enjoy the all-you-can-drink highball even if you're drinking alone. The snacks are delicious no matter what you order. It's definitely here.

The lamb chops were absolutely delicious. Sausages are also good.
The audience is seated around a long hearth. The food is cooked and eaten right in front of you, and the time it takes to bake it is like a feast. Chatting with strangers around the fireplace. Laughter echoed in the small, just-right space. It's okay to have a glass of wine on those days. I think this is a place where you can do that.

Shio ramen, clear soup base.
There have many kind of peppers on the table.
The fried chicken big piece, not karaage size.

I went with a friend who loves shellfish.
Wife? The shopkeeper? I don't know why, but it seemed like he was cooking by himself.
However, the food wasn't slow to come out, and there were quite a few types of local sake, so it was very good.

A wonderful restaurant in every way.
Lunch on weekdays is fully booked.
Great food that is clearly popular.

I received a petit course.
Appetizer or soup, main dish, sweets platter, the cost performance is too good considering the contents!

Anyway, the taste is absolutely delicious.

The lady who serves the food is comforting and warm.

This is a genuine restaurant that I hope will remain in Hakodate forever.

Love the old school Yakiniku style resturant
Traditional type of joint
Food is tasty and service is well attended by their staffs there

Being a regular traveller to Japan , I love the atmosphere and ambience of the place

I do hope to visit again if I visit Hokkaido/Hakodate again

As the name of the store is CAMP, the store has a variety of outdoor furniture and is very comfortable.
The pork plate was super delicious!
On my first visit, I had the sautÃ©ed pork plate with butter, and it was so delicious that I went back the next day and had the Sapporo spicy miso flavor.
Both flavors were addictive!
There are 5 flavors in total, so I would like to try the other flavors as well.
I had the gyoza with the recommended vinegar, but the slightly sweet vinegar made it delicious even without soy sauce!

We ordered the green tea cake, milk soft serve and coffee. Of these, my favorite was the cake. It was super light and had great green tea flavor. The soft serve and coffee were good, but not amazing. Overall, a nice chill cafe to sit at and have some dessert.

It's completely different from the advertisement. It's actually a cassette stove rather than a grid grill.
The advertising table is a large dining table, but it's actually this small and only knee-high ottoman? I get burnt by oil splashes on the low table in my bedroom.
Naturally, the grilled vegetables and meat were not put on the table, but were packed in take-out food packs.
It was a meager item carried in a plastic bag.
I went there by car, and the advertisement said they had non-alcoholic beer, so I chose this one, but they actually didn't have any.

The hotel's elegant rooftop was advertised as a resort, but it was far from elegant or resort.
If you go up the stairs to the entrance, you will see just a rooftop that was used as a storage room with beer barrels piled up.
Grilled rice balls are delivered frozen,
The corn is raw and it takes quite a while to cook on the cassette stove + iron plate. Without providing correct information
I don't recommend it because it's far from reality.
Love the sushi here. High quality for a decent price (but not cheap).  Fast and polite service. Clean atmosphere.

Went here for dinner. Have tried sapporo soup curry, and I really love this Hakodate soup pork version. Ordered a level 1 spicy and really tasty and nice. Staff also very politely, you can ask  Chinese or English menu if you don't understand Japanese. Those who likes beer, they do serve beer!!

Best Soup Curry in town, especially ç‚™ã‚Š(aburi) dishes, which is one of the kind. From the taste, utensils, to plate presentation, you can feel the profession and attentiveness of the chefs and staff, not to mention at a bargain price. A MUST-GO in Hakodate.

Really excellent. Master was very friendly and knowledgeable. Hiromasa (amberjack) was yummy but he says only gets one fish per year.

Update went back this week (after two years) and afraid gone from 5 stars to two.

A fast-food-style restaurant chain found only in Hakodate. The restaurant can be easily spotted, thanks to its uniquely bright colors from the outset to the distinctively carnival interior. Menus on offer are curry rice, rice omelette, steak and the chain's most famous dish is burger. Prices are very reasonable. We were at this restaurant around noon and it was packed inside as well as cars in parking area. Actually we stopped by the restaurant at a branch in Onuma on the day before but there was a long queue in front of the store so we decided to skip. Most patrons are family and young people. It was a lively atmosphere to eat in. Definitely worth visiting at least once when in Hakodate.

The owner is very cheerful, and the atmosphere is where people as diverse as the multinational food come together to drink and talk. This is a place where people are forced to join in. It was my first night in Hakodate and I had an unforgettable experience. It was so much fun.

A salon bar with a great atmosphere where you can enjoy a drink while enjoying Mt. Hakodate and the night view â™ª You can enjoy an adult space â™ª You can use it even if you don't plan to stay overnight!

Cute western bar. I ordered the Hamburg steak set with cheese which many other local customers seem to order. It was the best Hamburg Iâ€™ve had in Hokkaido and Japan so far. Huge portion yet still very soft and full of flavor from the sauce.

We tried the assorted tuna with rice set and a set of shredded crab stick and sea urchin with rice, quality is not very good, the price on the other hand is more reasonable than other stores in that market area. Having said that, all stores in that morning market area set prices I feel unreasonably high (prices for tourists), so this place is a place to avoid rip-offs.

I went with a friend for lunch. The lunch set includes an assorted appetizer plate, fresh bread, a main dish (today's choices were lasagna, fish, or chicken), dessert, and coffee/tea for 2300 yen.
Everything was delicious and made fresh! The bread was just out of the oven, and the cheese on the pasta was still bubbling.

A store I wanted to visit once. I went there several times and it wasn't open, but it was finally open and I was able to sit down right away. happy.
This is my first time eating Genghis Khan at the counter. A rather nice atmosphere. Delicious Genghis Khan while drinking alcohol. There aren't many tourists so it's relaxing.
Dipping the flavored butter that comes with the lamb steak on the grilled shiitake mushrooms makes them delicious. The octopus kimchi is also addictingly delicious. The egg soup is also delicious.

Genghis Khan is mainly meat, not vegetables.

we had a really good time here in Jan 2023. The host is very kind, friendly and attentive. Thereâ€™s all kinds of professional whisky, wine or cocktails to choose from the menu. A great marriage anniversary night in Hakodate. The selection of meat are awesome. Not only the signature beef tongue is great, also worth to try the Hida and Kobe beef. Alcoholic beverages may not their strength but a nice highball can solve anything.
Retro burger stand. Burger was good, tasted just like my last visit. Curry rice was delicious too. There was a pretty long line tho there were seats available.

Had a wonderful group dinner here the other night. The service was decent, the food was fantastic!!! I got the chicken vegetable soup curry set. This came with a choice of nan/rice, you choose your soup base, a drink hot/cold and dessert regular yoghurt or mango yoghurt. I also ordered the green coconut man and cheese man to try out. I have to say that everything I ordered was great. My only down point was that the curry wasn't as spicy as I'd have liked it to be but I'm guessing that is in tandem with the Japanese pallet of not usually liking spicy foods.
The decor was nice but the restaurant is  small so even though they did groups don't bring a large group. My dinner party was about 10 persons.

It was straight out of the 1980â€™s, all a mess of bar seating tables, unused fire pit, stacked chairs, baby chairs and boxes, and a second floor that all but obliterated the promise of soaring ceilings that we had imagined from the outside.

The beer was not to our liking (but thatâ€™s just personal taste).  What was not okay was the price. The tastings (for less that 500ml of beer) was Â¥1,760. That in a town where a half litre of beer will cost you Â¥500.  Only ordered one item of food, and it was significantly smaller portion that shown on the menu.  However, my mate was very pleased with the taste.

Ordering was done by a tablet, and it worked well.  It was one of the better systems we have seen.
Very good pancakes and the onion soup was really tasty. The coffees well served and in huge mugs. Service was 10/10. Overall recommended place to visit

I really recommend this restaurant.I   arrived around 8AM. There were a few people in the queue. The restaurant is quite small. There are not many tables but turn over rate is quite fast. I went to this restaurant two day in a row during staying in Hakodate.

Take National Route 228 (Isarihi-dori) from Yunokawa towards Mt. Hakodate, take the branch towards Cape Tatemachi, and the entrance is immediately to the left after passing the brown nursing home. There is a fee for parking, but if you enter the building and use the machine at the reception desk on the right, you can park for free for up to 2 hours. The store is located on the right side as you enter, and the menu consists of noodles such as ramen, yakisoba, and spaghetti, and rice dishes such as omelet rice and fried rice, and there are no set meals. On this day, I ordered special ramen (miso). The pleasantly sweet soup had a tangy spiciness that went well with the medium-thick curly noodles and was delicious with plenty of toppings. The Ankake Yakisoba and other menu items looked delicious, so I would like to visit again.

Thank you for your delicious meal.
I went around 8pm and it seemed busy.
A friend who knows this place had made a reservation for me, so I sat down right away. I was waiting because I had an appointment.
Both the entrance and the store are beautifully designed.
Recommendations are listed separately on the whiteboard, so please ask.

There were quite a few types of alcohol, and there was a separate laminated menu.
The sashimi is small and easy to eat.
The grilled silver dagger with miso sauce was fluffy and full of flavor, it was amazing! Maybe I should have drank sake (*Â´è‰¸ï½€)
Great experience a bit of misunderstanding at the start but the manager went over the bar and beyond to help solve the problem. Highly recommend the Japanese whisky

The restaurant had an upscale feel to it, and I got the impression that there were many families in formal attire.
I stopped by for lunch and tried the popular homme demi, but the demi sauce made it taste like an adult.
Since it is located on the outskirts of Hakodate City, it seems that the store is used more by local residents than tourists, but if you have access to a rental car or other vehicle, tourists are welcome to stop by as well.

This place was so lovely. We went for lunch and they were all so welcoming. I got their value set and my partner got their grilled yakitori set. The only issue was that I got served first and was pretty much done with my meal by the time his grilled food arrived. We chilled and enjoyed the coffee that came with the meal. It was hot. We came here after the park. Definitely recommend.

The sushi was delicious and reasonably priced considering the quality. The fried squid was also delicious.

There were plenty of cooked food options for those who donâ€™t prefer raw fish, and kidsâ€™ meals are available too.

Instead of a conveyor belt, we ordered through a tablet, but the sushi was just as pictured.

Rushing to catch the train so I went in this restaurant because it has seats and there is no need to queue. Wish I had read the reviews first. The food is really bad and the sashimi served is not fresh though itâ€™s located in the morning market!

Donâ€™t even serve fresh wasabi, only their blended wasabi soy sauce.

You'll find the most delicious and homemade Japanese food here. The mother and daughter were very welcoming even with the language barrier. They used google translate to talk to me, but it was a bit busy so I didn't want to keep them from taking care of other customers.

No set menu, whatever is cooked that day will be the set course.

A ramen shop that I used to love and used to go to often.
It was good at first, but the taste changed every time I went and there were a lot of order mistakes.

I had stopped going, but

I ordered the red spicy miso ramen that I used to eat a lot.

Hakodateâ€™s own home brand of hamburgers which you can see all over Hakodate- Lucky Pierrot serves asian style hamburger. The queue might be long (depending on the outlet you visit) but service is relatively fast.

Once you order, you find a table and inform them your table number. We tried the chinese chicken burger which tasted similar to deep fried 5 spice chicken. The tonkatsu burger was quite meaty as well.

A good place to go for western tourist. You grill the meat yourself, Japanese style. Each room is separated from the others by removable panels. Staff does not speak English but the menu has plenty of pictures. Easy to order.

As an American I feel proud to say Iâ€™ve eaten my fair share of good burgers. If youâ€™re feeling homesick, you will LOVE this place.

Burgers are just fantastic. Theyâ€™re made like art and taste just amazing. Fries and salad are a great touch too. Music is super fun and upbeat, playing some rock-instrumental covers of famous American pop music songs. Drinks were great too! I was also happy to finally be at a restaurant that had ketchup.

I came here because of the good reviews.
A set that includes a choice of meat or fish and main dish, rice or bread, salad, soup, and drink. The pasta set includes a drink and salad.
Today's meat lunch is hamburger and omelet. Easy to eat taste.
The soup was delicious. Today's soup is pumpkin soup.
The menu changes every month, so I'd like to go again.
It's been a long time since I've been here.
This time it was turnip soup.
I chose the fish. The shrimp croquette was really delicious

Great little izakaya! There is no English or picture menu but the owners were lovely and extremely accommodating given our complete lack of comprehension. We ordered mostly by pointing at what other people were eating and at photos on Google. They were so good natured and even gave us a free little snack. Food was delicious - must order the grilled fish and the grilled squid!

This restaurant was recommended by a local Hakodate so our anticipation was high.   The restaurant did not disappoint as the eel plate was fresh and tasty.   The scallops were very sweet and a bit "crunch".   Overall, a nice experience.

The staff and environment is great. Were in a private dining area and really love the atmosphere. Staff was attentive and helpful. Nevertheless, our objective was to be able to compare the beef type in Japan. As this is our 3rd week in Japan and after trying out kobe (in kyoto) and hida (in takaysms) beef from different restaurants we decided to try here because we wanted to compare taste of hida and kobe beef. So we ordered A5 Hida center cut ribs, A5 kobe chuck ribs, A5 Japanese black beef fillet cube and beef tongue. When the dish came, we were utterly disappointed as the marbling was missing. We thought maybe after BBQ it will be ok. To our disappointment, it doest meet the mark. It is still edible but no where compare to the ones we ate in kyoto or takayama. Honestly, we felt rip off.
As we paid, we were shown kind gesture with popsicles hence the 2 star for food.
Overall, I think its a 3 star. Food felt rip off but service and atmosphere is excellent.

I entered the restaurant on a weekday night to have a meal with a customer.
This is a shop where you can smoke cigarettes.
It wasn't that smoky, probably due to good ventilation.

We had an assortment of sashimi for each person. The beer was bubbly and delicious, but I wonder if the quantity was a little small. Abundant Japanese sake. There was also sake from Hakodate.
The toilet is very spacious and clean.

Tabiji is a seafood don restaurant renowned for its fresh, high-quality offerings. I visited to try the live squid over rice, and it was an unforgettable experience. The seafood is incredibly fresh, with the live squid still moving when itâ€™s served. The tentacles continue to move as you eat, gently interacting with each other and releasing sweet, succulent juices. Itâ€™s a unique and intense culinary experience.

A word of advice: be prepared to remove your shoes, as the seating here is traditional tatami style, where diners sit on mats.

Some cultures believe that eating live seafood, like squid, enhances the freshness and flavor, providing a more vibrant taste. The staff at Tabiji went out of their way to communicate with English-speaking customers like me, creating a warm and comfortable dining atmosphere. Their efforts truly made the experience even more enjoyable.

After discovering this sushi restaurant on Google Maps, we decided to give it a shot. We ordered set, which consisted of 10 pieces. Most of the sushi pieces were absolutely delicious, with flavors that delighted our taste buds. However, I must admit that the crab meat sushi was slightly less appealing compared to the others. Nevertheless, I highly recommend giving this place a try!
Every dishes tasted good.
It took over 30 minutes to come to take the order, over an hour and a half for the food to come out, and over 10 minutes to pay for everything.

Best uni, freshest uni, tastiest uni, and most creative uni I ever had. This restaurant specializes in uni, so if you love uni like me, you have to try it here. And if you do, come early or you will be waiting in a long line, cuz the place is no that big. We came 30 min before it open, and there is already a short line. It is on the pricy side, but for the quality and freshness you get, it's well worth it.

Everything we ordered was really flavourful. Ramen broth was thick and noodles were cooked well. They also provide garlic that you can crush yourself to add extra flavour.

We also ordered the gyoza which was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside; and the fried rice which was yummy.

Their house sakÃ© (180ml servings) is pretty good as well. We had 5!

Delicious tempura! Fresh from the sea daily. They have daily specials.
The sea urchin and fish were cooked perfectly. Would recommend the scallops.
